topic.title: Placing PDU on Optional Floor Stand

body.p: The PDU can be placed on an optional floor stand that will support the PDU’s weight. Floor stands are available in several heights to match the height of your installation’s raised floor, ranging from 11" to 76".

Each floor stand provides a height range and is adjustable within that range. Center supports are provided on the larger floor stands (48", 60", and 72" height). (See to .) Fixed-height floor stand are also available in 8-11" heights. At time of order, select the floor stand that matches your raised floor height.

li.p: Remove floor tiles and/or make floor tile cutouts to match the width and depth of the floor stand ().
Place the floor stand within the raised floor opening and bolt feet securely to the subfloor. See leg detail in .

To adjust the floor stand height, adjust the bottom height-adjustment screws. To prevent air flow escaping around the base of the PDU, choose one of these options:
Option 1: Reduce the height of the floor stand so that the top of the floor stand is about 1½" below the top of the raised floor. When the PDU is placed on the floor stand, the PDU base should be even with the floor.
Option 2: Match the floor stand to your raised floor height. Install an optional PDU skirt to minimize loss of air flow.
The floor stand has removable front and rear cover plates for cable entry/exit and air flow. To provide adequate air flow, remove cover plates before placing the PDU on the floor stand. (See ”)

To stabilize the PDU on the floor stand, there are two options:
Option 1: Remove the PDU leveling feet, allowing the PDU to rest on its casters. (The casters rotate 360⁰ but do not lock.) Bolt the PDU to the floor stand using 1/2" all thread (). Some customers invert the removed leveling feet and use them to attach the PDU to the floor stand.
Option 2: Adjust the main cabinet leveling feet so that they all rest firmly on the floor stand ().

With a fork lift or pallet jack, carefully position the PDU over the floor stand. The main cabinet should be centered directly over the floor stand. If you are using the main cabinet leveling feet, they should all be positioned within the borders of the floor stand’s top plate.
